title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: IT Analysts and Consultants

content.rendered:
What are IT Analysts and Consultants?

Internet Technology (IT) Analysts and Consultants are in charge of implementing and upgrading computer systems for a company. They are also seen as the main technology resource in the company and often to help other employees troubleshoot any technology issues they may be experiencing.

Where do IT Analysts and Consultants work?

  • Computer systems companies
  • Finance companies
  • Tech consultant companies

How much do IT Analysts and Consultants make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for IT Analysts and Consultants is $70,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming IT Analysts and Consultants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Engineering majors
Search IT Analyst and Consultant jobs

IT Analyst and Consultant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring IT Analysts and Consultants succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail
  • Knowledge of applicable software
  • Teamwork skills

What are some common questions about IT Analysts and Consultants?

Q: What’s it like to be an IT Analyst intern?

A: Check out student responses and real intern experiences here.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming IT Analysts and Consultants.
